definition: aspect particle indicating action in progress
to make known/to show/to prove/to write/book/outstanding
to touch/to come in contact with/to feel/to be affected by/to catch fire/to burn/(coll.) to fall asleep/(after a verb) hitting the mark/succeeding in

sentences.english: Perhaps his coffee possesses some sort of magic which charms people?
sentences.chinese: 該不會是他的咖啡，有著會令人著迷的魔法吧？

sentences.english: It is no exaggeration to say many people are obsessed with horoscopes.
sentences.chinese: 如果說有一大堆人對星座著迷，可是一點也不誇張。

sentences.english: He even tells all the audiences present in the venue what allures him.
sentences.chinese: 他甚至是告訴了所有在場者，他著迷的是什麼。

sentences.english: he is crazy about crazy english.
Don't tell me you're finding the Harems more compelling than killing demons?
sentences.chinese: 別告訴我你現在發現婦女們要比殺惡魔更令人著迷？

sentences.english: A fascinated creature is entranced by a supernatural or spell effect.
sentences.chinese: 著迷狀態是指被超自然能力或是法術能力給迷住了。

sentences.english: The eternal motion of the stars fascinated him.
sentences.chinese: 星體永恆的運行使他著迷。

sentences.english: But the fascination with small beads of mercury has given way to talk of their potential risks.
sentences.chinese: 但是這種讓學生著迷的神奇金屬也有相當的潛在危險。

sentences.english: John was obsessed with a girl he had just met.
sentences.chinese: 約翰著迷一個剛認識的女孩。

sentences.english: This profession has been irresistibly fascinating for me.
sentences.chinese: 這行業一直讓我不能忘懷的著迷。

sentences.english: Mao is entranced by the new possibilities that he sees through diamonds.
sentences.chinese: 毛河光著迷於透過鑽石發現的新世界。

definition: lit. spirit and soul upside down (idiom); infatuated and head over heels in love/fascinated/captivated
to be infatuated with/to be enchanted by/to be passionate about
unable to take one's eyes off (idiom); to gaze steadily/to stare
lit. as if drunk and stupefied (idiom)/fig. intoxicated by sth/obsessed with/mad about sth
variant of 繆斯|缪斯[Miu4 si1]
to be surprised/to be amazed/to be stunned
to love sth too much to part with it (idiom); to fondle admiringly
